 48{
 49
 50inline void
 51transpose_simd_start()
 52{
 53#if VSIP_IMPL_TRANSPOSE_USE_3DNOW
 54  __asm__ __volatile__ ("femms");
 55#endif
 56}
 57
 58inline void
 59transpose_simd_stop()
 60{
 61#if VSIP_IMPL_TRANSPOSE_USE_3DNOW
 62  __asm__ __volatile__ ("femms");
 63#endif
 64}
 65
 66
 67
 68/***********************************************************************
 69  General Unrolled_transpose definitions
 70***********************************************************************/
 71
 72template <typename    T1,
 73	  typename    T2,
 74	  length_type Block,
 75	  bool        SimdAligned>
 76struct Unrolled_transpose
 77{
 78  static void exec(
 79    T1*               dst,
 80    T2 const*         src,
 81    stride_type const dst_col_stride,
 82    stride_type const src_row_stride)
 83  {
 84    typedef Unrolled_transpose<T1, T2, Block/2, SimdAligned> meta;
 85
 86    meta::exec(dst, src,
 87	       dst_col_stride,
 88	       src_row_stride);
 89    meta::exec(dst + (Block/2)*dst_col_stride, src + (Block/2),
 90	       dst_col_stride,
 91	       src_row_stride);
 92    meta::exec(dst + (Block/2), src + (Block/2)*src_row_stride,
 93	       dst_col_stride,
 94	       src_row_stride);
 95    meta::exec(dst + (Block/2) + (Block/2)*dst_col_stride,
 96	       src + (Block/2)*src_row_stride + (Block/2),
 97	       dst_col_stride,
 98	       src_row_stride);
 99  }
100};
101
102
103
104template <typename T1,
105	  typename T2,
106	  bool     SimdAligned>
107struct Unrolled_transpose<T1, T2, 1, SimdAligned>
108{
109  static void exec(
110    T1*               dst,
111    T2 const*         src,
112    stride_type const /*dst_col_stride*/,
113    stride_type const /*src_row_stride*/)
114  {
115    *dst = *src;
116  }
117};
118
119
120
121/***********************************************************************
122  SSE specific Unrolled_transpose definitions
123***********************************************************************/
124
125#if VSIP_IMPL_TRANSPOSE_USE_SSE
126// 4x4 float unaligned fragment for SSE.
127
128template <>
129struct Unrolled_transpose<float, float, 4, false>
130{
131  static void exec(
132    float*            dst,
133    float const*      src,
134    stride_type const dst_col_stride,
135    stride_type const src_row_stride)
136  {
137    __m128 row0 = _mm_loadu_ps(src + 0*src_row_stride + 0);
138    __m128 row1 = _mm_loadu_ps(src + 1*src_row_stride + 0);
139    __m128 row2 = _mm_loadu_ps(src + 2*src_row_stride + 0);
140    __m128 row3 = _mm_loadu_ps(src + 3*src_row_stride + 0);
141    _MM_TRANSPOSE4_PS(row0, row1, row2, row3);
142    _mm_storeu_ps(dst + 0 + 0*dst_col_stride, row0);
143    _mm_storeu_ps(dst + 0 + 1*dst_col_stride, row1);
144    _mm_storeu_ps(dst + 0 + 2*dst_col_stride, row2);
145    _mm_storeu_ps(dst + 0 + 3*dst_col_stride, row3);
146  }
147};
148
149
150
151// 4x4 float aligned fragment for SSE.
152
153template <>
154struct Unrolled_transpose<float, float, 4, true>
155{
156  static void exec(
157    float*            dst,
158    float const*      src,
159    stride_type const dst_col_stride,
160    stride_type const src_row_stride)
161  {
162    __m128 row0 = _mm_load_ps(src + 0*src_row_stride + 0);
163    __m128 row1 = _mm_load_ps(src + 1*src_row_stride + 0);
164    __m128 row2 = _mm_load_ps(src + 2*src_row_stride + 0);
165    __m128 row3 = _mm_load_ps(src + 3*src_row_stride + 0);
166    _MM_TRANSPOSE4_PS(row0, row1, row2, row3);
167    _mm_store_ps(dst + 0 + 0*dst_col_stride, row0);
168    _mm_store_ps(dst + 0 + 1*dst_col_stride, row1);
169    _mm_store_ps(dst + 0 + 2*dst_col_stride, row2);
170    _mm_store_ps(dst + 0 + 3*dst_col_stride, row3);
171  }
172};
173
174
175
176// 2x2 complex<float> unaligned fragment for SSE.
177
178template <>
179struct Unrolled_transpose<complex<float>, complex<float>, 2, false>
180{
181  static void exec(
182    complex<float>*       dst,
183    complex<float>const * src,
184    stride_type const     dst_col_stride,
185    stride_type const     src_row_stride)
186  {
187    __m128 row0 = _mm_loadu_ps(
188		reinterpret_cast<float const*>(src + 0*src_row_stride + 0));
189    __m128 row1 = _mm_loadu_ps(
190		reinterpret_cast<float const*>(src + 1*src_row_stride + 0));
191
192    __m128 col0 = _mm_shuffle_ps(row0, row1, 0x44); // 10 00 01 00
193    __m128 col1 = _mm_shuffle_ps(row0, row1, 0xEE); // 11 10 11 10
194
195    _mm_storeu_ps(reinterpret_cast<float*>(dst + 0 + 0*dst_col_stride), col0);
196    _mm_storeu_ps(reinterpret_cast<float*>(dst + 0 + 1*dst_col_stride), col1);
197  }
198};
199
200
201
202// 2x2 complex<float> aligned fragment for SSE.
203
204template <>
205struct Unrolled_transpose<complex<float>, complex<float>, 2, true>
206{
207  static void exec(
208    complex<float>*       dst,
209    complex<float>const * src,
210    stride_type const     dst_col_stride,
211    stride_type const     src_row_stride)
212  {
213    __m128 row0 = _mm_load_ps(
214		reinterpret_cast<float const*>(src + 0*src_row_stride + 0));
215    __m128 row1 = _mm_load_ps(
216		reinterpret_cast<float const*>(src + 1*src_row_stride + 0));
217
218    __m128 col0 = _mm_shuffle_ps(row0, row1, 0x44); // 10 00 01 00
219    __m128 col1 = _mm_shuffle_ps(row0, row1, 0xEE); // 11 10 11 10
220
221    _mm_store_ps(reinterpret_cast<float*>(dst + 0 + 0*dst_col_stride), col0);
222    _mm_store_ps(reinterpret_cast<float*>(dst + 0 + 1*dst_col_stride), col1);
223  }
224};
225#endif
226
227
228
229/***********************************************************************
230  3DNow! specific Unrolled_transpose definitions
231***********************************************************************/
232
233#if VSIP_IMPL_TRANSPOSE_USE_3DNOW
234
235typedef float __v2sf __attribute__ ((__mode__ (__V2SF__),__aligned__(8)));
236
237template <bool     SimdAligned>
238struct Unrolled_transpose<float, float, 2, SimdAligned>
239{
240  static void exec(
241    float*            dst,
242    float const*      src,
243    stride_type const dst_col_stride,
244    stride_type const src_row_stride)
245  {
246    __v2sf row0 = *(__v2sf*)(src  + 0*src_row_stride + 0);
247    __v2sf row1 = *(__v2sf*)(src  + 1*src_row_stride + 0);
248
249    __v2sf col0 = (__v2sf)_m_punpckldq((__m64)row0, (__m64)row1);
250    __v2sf col1 = (__v2sf)_m_punpckhdq((__m64)row0, (__m64)row1);
251
252    *(__v2sf*)(dst + 0 + 0*dst_col_stride) = col0;
253    *(__v2sf*)(dst + 0 + 1*dst_col_stride) = col1;
254  }
255};
256
257template <bool     SimdAligned>
258struct Unrolled_transpose<complex<float>, complex<float>, 1, SimdAligned>
259{
260  static void exec(
261    complex<float>*         dst,
262    complex<float> const*   src,
263    stride_type const       /*dst_col_stride*/,
264    stride_type const       /*src_row_stride*/)
265  {
266    __v2sf row0 = *(__v2sf*)(src);
267
268    *(__v2sf*)(dst) = row0;
269  }
270};
271#endif
272
273
274
275/***********************************************************************
276  Definitions - transpose_unit
277***********************************************************************/
278
279// transpose_unit implementation tags.
280
281struct Impl_loop {};
282template <length_type Block, bool SimdAligned> struct Impl_block_iter {};
283template <length_type Block, bool SimdAligned> struct Impl_block_recur {};
284template <length_type Block, bool SimdAligned> struct Impl_block_recur_helper
285{};
286struct Impl_recur {};
287
288template <typename T1,
289	  typename T2>
290void
291transpose_unit(
292  T1*               dst,
293  T2 const*         src,
294  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
295  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
296  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
297  stride_type const src_row_stride,
298  Impl_loop)
299{
300  for (index_type r=0; r<rows; ++r)
301    for (index_type c=0; c<cols; ++c)
302      dst[r+c*dst_col_stride] = src[r*src_row_stride+c];
303}
304
305
306
307#if VSIP_IMPL_TRANSPOSE_USE_3DNOW
308template <>
309inline void
310transpose_unit(
311  complex<float>*       dst,
312  complex<float> const* src,
313  length_type const     rows,		// dst rows
314  length_type const     cols,		// dst cols
315  stride_type const     dst_col_stride,
316  stride_type const     src_row_stride,
317  Impl_loop)
318{
319  __asm__ __volatile__ ("femms");
320  for (index_type r=0; r<rows; ++r)
321    for (index_type c=0; c<cols; ++c)
322    {
323      __v2sf row0 = *(__v2sf*)(src + r*src_row_stride+c);
324      *(__v2sf*)(dst + r+c*dst_col_stride) = row0;
325    }
326  __asm__ __volatile__ ("femms");
327}
328#endif
329
330
331
332/// Blocked transpose, using iteration over blocks.
333
334template <typename    T1,
335	  typename    T2,
336	  length_type Block,
337	  bool        SimdAligned>
338void
339transpose_unit(
340  T1*               dst,
341  T2 const*         src,
342  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
343  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
344  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
345  stride_type const src_row_stride,
346  Impl_block_iter<Block, SimdAligned>)
347{
348  length_type full_cols = cols - cols%Block;
349  length_type full_rows = rows - rows%Block;
350
351  // Transpose core of matrix using Unrolled_transpose a block
352  // at a time.
353
354  for (index_type r=0; r<full_rows; r += Block)
355    for (index_type c=0; c<full_cols; c += Block)
356    {
357      transpose_simd_start();
358      Unrolled_transpose<T1, T2, Block, SimdAligned>::exec(
359			dst + r + c*dst_col_stride,
360			src + r*src_row_stride + c,
361			dst_col_stride,
362			src_row_stride);
363      transpose_simd_stop();
364    }
365
366
367  // Cleanup edges of matrix using Impl_loop.
368
369  if (full_cols != cols)
370  {
371    length_type extra_cols = cols - full_cols;
372    for (index_type r=0; r<full_rows; r += Block)
373      transpose_unit(dst + r + full_cols*dst_col_stride,
374		     src + r*src_row_stride + full_cols,
375		     Block, extra_cols,
376		     dst_col_stride,
377		     src_row_stride,
378		     Impl_loop());
379  }
380  if (full_rows != rows)
381  {
382    length_type extra_rows = rows - full_rows;
383    for (index_type c=0; c<full_cols; c += Block)
384      transpose_unit(dst + full_rows + c*dst_col_stride,
385		     src + full_rows*src_row_stride + c,
386		     extra_rows, Block,
387		     dst_col_stride,
388		     src_row_stride,
389		     Impl_loop());
390    if (full_cols != cols)
391    {
392      transpose_unit(dst + full_rows + full_cols*dst_col_stride,
393		     src + full_rows*src_row_stride + full_cols,
394		     extra_rows, cols - full_cols,
395		     dst_col_stride,
396		     src_row_stride,
397		     Impl_loop());
398    }
399  }
400}
401
402
403
404/// Recurcive blocked transpose helper function.
405
406/// This routine performs the recursive sub-division for Impl_block_recur.
407
408template <typename    T1,
409	  typename    T2,
410	  length_type Block,
411	  bool        SimdAligned>
412void
413transpose_unit(
414  T1*               dst,
415  T2 const*         src,
416  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
417  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
418  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
419  stride_type const src_row_stride,
420  Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>)
421{
422  length_type const thresh = 4*Block;
423  if (rows <= thresh && cols <= thresh)
424  {
425    for (index_type r=0; r<rows; r+=Block)
426      for (index_type c=0; c<cols; c+=Block)
427	Unrolled_transpose<T1, T2, Block, SimdAligned>::exec(
428			dst + r + c*dst_col_stride,
429			src + r*src_row_stride + c,
430			dst_col_stride,
431			src_row_stride);
432  }
433  else if (cols >= rows)
434  {
435    length_type cols1 = ((cols/Block)/2) * Block;
436    length_type cols2 = cols - cols1;
437
438    transpose_unit(dst,          src,
439		   rows, cols1,
440		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
441		   Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>());
442
443    transpose_unit(dst + (cols1)*dst_col_stride, src + (cols1),
444		   rows, cols2,
445		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
446		   Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>());
447  }
448  else
449  {
450    length_type rows1 = ((rows/Block)/2) * Block;
451    length_type rows2 = rows - rows1;
452
453    transpose_unit(dst,          src,
454		   rows1, cols,
455		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
456		   Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>());
457
458    transpose_unit(dst + (rows1), src + (rows1)*src_row_stride,
459		   rows2, cols,
460		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
461		   Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>());
462  }
463}
464
465
466
467/// Blocked transpose, using recursion over blocks.
468
469template <typename    T1,
470	  typename    T2,
471	  length_type Block,
472	  bool        SimdAligned>
473void
474transpose_unit(
475  T1*            dst,
476  T2 const*      src,
477  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
478  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
479  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
480  stride_type const src_row_stride,
481  Impl_block_recur<Block, SimdAligned>)
482{
483  length_type full_cols = cols - cols%Block;
484  length_type full_rows = rows - rows%Block;
485
486  // Transpose core of matrix using Unrolled_transpose a block
487  // at a time.
488
489  transpose_simd_start();
490  transpose_unit(dst, src, full_rows, full_cols,
491		 dst_col_stride,
492		 src_row_stride,
493		 Impl_block_recur_helper<Block, SimdAligned>());
494  transpose_simd_stop();
495
496
497  // Cleanup edges of matrix using Impl_loop.
498
499  if (full_cols != cols)
500  {
501    length_type extra_cols = cols - full_cols;
502    for (index_type r=0; r<full_rows; r += Block)
503      transpose_unit(dst + r + full_cols*dst_col_stride,
504		     src + r*src_row_stride + full_cols,
505		     Block, extra_cols,
506		     dst_col_stride,
507		     src_row_stride,
508		     Impl_loop());
509  }
510  if (full_rows != rows)
511  {
512    length_type extra_rows = rows - full_rows;
513    for (index_type c=0; c<full_cols; c += Block)
514      transpose_unit(dst + full_rows + c*dst_col_stride,
515		     src + full_rows*src_row_stride + c,
516		     extra_rows, Block,
517		     dst_col_stride,
518		     src_row_stride,
519		     Impl_loop());
520    if (full_cols != cols)
521    {
522      transpose_unit(dst + full_rows + full_cols*dst_col_stride,
523		     src + full_rows*src_row_stride + full_cols,
524		     extra_rows, cols - full_cols,
525		     dst_col_stride,
526		     src_row_stride,
527		     Impl_loop());
528    }
529  }
530}
531
532
533
534// Recurively decomposed transposition for unit-strides.
535
536// Algorithm based on "Cache-Oblivious Algorithms (Extended Abstract)"
537// by M. Frigo, C. Leiseron, H. Prokop, S. Ramachandran.
538// citeseer.csail.mit.edu/307799.html.
539
540template <typename T1,
541	  typename T2>
542void
543transpose_unit(
544  T1*               dst,
545  T2 const*         src,
546  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
547  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
548  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
549  stride_type const src_row_stride,
550  Impl_recur)
551{
552  length_type const thresh = 16;
553  if (rows <= thresh && cols <= thresh)
554  {
555    for (index_type r=0; r<rows; ++r)
556      for (index_type c=0; c<cols; ++c)
557	dst[r+c*dst_col_stride] = src[r*src_row_stride+c];
558  }
559  else if (cols >= rows)
560  {
561    transpose_unit(dst,          src,
562		   rows, cols/2,
563		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
564
565    transpose_unit(dst + (cols/2)*dst_col_stride, src + (cols/2),
566		   rows, cols/2 + cols%2,
567		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
568  }
569  else
570  {
571    transpose_unit(dst,          src,
572		   rows/2, cols,
573		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
574
575    transpose_unit(dst + (rows/2), src + (rows/2)*src_row_stride,
576		   rows/2 + rows%2, cols,
577		   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
578  }
579}
580
581} // namespace vsip::impl::trans_detail
582
583
584// Unit-stride transpose dispatch function.
585
586template <typename T1,
587	  typename T2>
588inline void
589transpose_unit(
590  T1*            dst,
591  T2 const*      src,
592  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
593  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
594  stride_type const dst_col_stride,
595  stride_type const src_row_stride)
596{
597  // Intel C++ 9.1 for Windows has trouble with transpose_unit()
598  // when T1 and T2 are complex<>.  This appears to be a compiler
599  // bug (see icl-transpose-assign.cpp).
600  //
601  // Empircally, it appears we can avoid this bug by forgoing
602  // dispatch on block size and ignoring SIMD alignment.
603  // (060914)
604#if _WIN32
605  // #if 0
606  trans_detail::transpose_unit(dst, src, rows, cols,
607			       dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
608			       trans_detail::Impl_block_recur<4, false>()
609			       );
610#else
611  // Check if data is aligned for SSE ISA.
612  //  - pointers need to be 16-byte aligned
613  //  - rows/cols need to start with 16-byte alignment.
614  bool aligned = 
615    (((unsigned long)dst                      ) & 0xf) == 0 &&
616    (((unsigned long)src                      ) & 0xf) == 0 &&
617    (((unsigned long)dst_col_stride*sizeof(T1)) & 0xf) == 0 &&
618    (((unsigned long)src_row_stride*sizeof(T1)) & 0xf) == 0;
619
620  if (rows < 16 || cols < 16)
621  {
622    if (aligned)
623      trans_detail::transpose_unit(dst, src, rows, cols,
624				   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
625				   trans_detail::Impl_block_recur<4, true>()
626				   );
627    else
628      trans_detail::transpose_unit(dst, src, rows, cols,
629				   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
630				   trans_detail::Impl_block_recur<4, false>()
631				   );
632  }
633  else
634  {
635    if (aligned)
636      trans_detail::transpose_unit(dst, src, rows, cols,
637				   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
638				   trans_detail::Impl_block_recur<16, true>()
639				   );
640    else
641      trans_detail::transpose_unit(dst, src, rows, cols,
642				   dst_col_stride, src_row_stride,
643				   trans_detail::Impl_block_recur<16, false>()
644				   );
645  }
646#endif
647}
648
649
650
651template <typename T1,
652	  typename T2>
653inline void
654transpose_unit(
655  std::pair<T1*, T1*> const& dst,
656  std::pair<T2*, T2*> const& src,
657  length_type const          rows,		// dst rows
658  length_type const          cols,		// dst cols
659  stride_type const          dst_col_stride,
660  stride_type const          src_row_stride)
661{
662  transpose_unit(dst.first, src.first,
663		 rows, cols, dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
664  transpose_unit(dst.second, src.second,
665		 rows, cols, dst_col_stride, src_row_stride);
666}
667
668
669
670// Transpose for matrices with arbitrary strides.
671
672// Algorithm based on "Cache-Oblivious Algorithms (Extended Abstract)"
673// by M. Frigo, C. Leiseron, H. Prokop, S. Ramachandran.
674// citeseer.csail.mit.edu/307799.html.
675template <typename T1,
676	  typename T2>
677void
678transpose(
679  T1*               dst,
680  T2 const*         src,
681  length_type const rows,		// dst rows
682  length_type const cols,		// dst cols
683  stride_type const dst_stride0,
684  stride_type const dst_stride1,	// eq. to dst_col_stride
685  stride_type const src_stride0,	// eq. to src_row_stride
686  stride_type const src_stride1)
687{
688  length_type const thresh = 16;
689  if (rows <= thresh && cols <= thresh)
690  {
691    for (index_type r=0; r<rows; ++r)
692      for (index_type c=0; c<cols; ++c)
693	dst[r*dst_stride0+c*dst_stride1] = src[r*src_stride0+c*src_stride1];
694  }
695  else if (cols >= rows)
696  {
697    transpose(dst,          src,
698	      rows, cols/2,
699	      dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
700	      src_stride0, src_stride1);
701
702    transpose(dst + (cols/2)*dst_stride1, src + (cols/2)*src_stride1,
703	      rows, cols/2 + cols%2,
704	      dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
705	      src_stride0, src_stride1);
706  }
707  else
708  {
709    transpose(dst,          src,
710	      rows/2, cols,
711	      dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
712	      src_stride0, src_stride1);
713
714    transpose(dst + (rows/2)*dst_stride0, src + (rows/2)*src_stride0,
715	      rows/2 + rows%2, cols,
716	      dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
717	      src_stride0, src_stride1);
718  }
719}
720
721template <typename T1,
722	  typename T2>
723void
724transpose(
725  std::pair<T1*, T1*> const& dst,
726  std::pair<T2*, T2*> const& src,
727  length_type const          rows,		// dst rows
728  length_type const          cols,		// dst cols
729  stride_type const          dst_stride0,
730  stride_type const          dst_stride1,
731  stride_type const          src_stride0,
732  stride_type const          src_stride1)
733{
734  transpose(dst.first, src.first,
735	    rows, cols,
736	    dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
737	    src_stride0, src_stride1);
738  transpose(dst.second, src.second,
739	    rows, cols,
740	    dst_stride0, dst_stride1,
741	    src_stride0, src_stride1);
742}
743
744} // namespace vsip::impl
745} // namespace vsip
746
747#endif // VSIP_IMPL_FAST_TRANSPOSE_HPP
Generated on Sat Apr 17 11:14:53 2010 by
synopsis (version 0.12)
